title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.7 - Prohibitions
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9 ยง 6171.7 - Prohibitions

State Regulations
(a) Eligible
witness information. Information, files and records created pursuant to this

Part in the possession of provider agencies and related solely to service
provided by such agency are confidential and may not be disclosed by any
person. Such information, files and records are not subject to disclosure in
any judicial or administrative proceeding unless the court in which the
criminal proceeding is pending or was disposed of, upon notice to the district
attorney and an opportunity to be heard, determines that such disclosure would
not endanger the health, welfare or safety of the witness or the family of the
witness and is compelled by the interests of justice. (b) Funding prohibition. (1)

No funds awarded pursuant to this Part
shall be used to purchase firearms or other deadly weapons. No authorization
exists under this Part for the possession, carrying, utilization, dissemination
or acquisition of firearms or other deadly weapons. (2)

No funds awarded pursuant to this Part
may be used on private guard services, including salaries, fees or expenses
incurred for hiring of or for use of private guards. No funds may be used to
purchase guard dogs or guard dog services. (3)

No funds awarded pursuant to this Part
may be used to pay for the preparation of project proposals. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 9
ยง
6171.7

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
